Benefits of API Mocking

  2. API Mocking Tools: Prism [4]

Benefits of API Mocking Frank Kilcommins: API Management in Practice: Introduction to API Mocking

(3) API Mocking: The Benefits

  • Allows for exploratory feedback and experimentation for multiple use cases:
    • Stakeholder collaboration & fast feedback loops
    • Test suite validation
    • Health checks (and governance checks)
    • Rapid prototyping (can be used by API consumers in their apps)
    • Unblock testers, technical writers, etc. (no need to wait for development completion)
  • Accelerate by spinning up mock APIs which are driven by your API descriptions (e.g. OpenAPI)


Benefits of API Mocking Frank Kilcommins: API Management in Practice: Introduction to API Mocking

(4) API Mocking: Iterate Faster with Early Feedback

  • Embrace the power of early feedback
    • Incorporate user input during the design phase of your API
    • Don't wait until after code is written
  • This proactive approach significantly reduces the cost of change, allowing you to quickly iterate and refine your API based on consumer (or critical stakeholder feedback)


Benefits of API Mocking Frank Kilcommins: API Management in Practice: Introduction to API Mocking

(5) API Mocking: Work in Parallel

  • Accelerate delivery by working in parallel
    • Provider (e.g. backend dev team) and consumer (e.g. frontend dev team) can work simultaneously
    • Testers can create functional tests and verify against mock APIs
    • Technical writers can create documentation in parallel with development & testing


API Mocking Tools: Prism

Outline (API Mocking Tools: Prism)

  1. Benefits of API Mocking [3]
  2. API Mocking Tools: Prism [4]
  3. Exercise (Demo): Mock an API [1]
API Mocking Tools: Prism Frank Kilcommins: API Management in Practice: Introduction to API Mocking

(7) Example Mocking Tool: Prism

  • Prism is an open-source HTTP mocking tool that emulates your API's behavior as if you already built it
  • Prism generates mock HTTP servers from your OpenAPI 2.* / 3.* definitions


API Mocking Tools: Prism Frank Kilcommins: API Management in Practice: Introduction to API Mocking

(8) API Mocking: Dynamic Examples

  • Static examples are good but they can bias the way you code and test the API
  • Many mocking tools (like Prism) generate dynamic random examples based on your schemas
  • Dynamic examples can help uncover edge cases and improve API design.


API Mocking Tools: Prism Frank Kilcommins: API Management in Practice: Introduction to API Mocking

(9) API Mocking: Validate Input and Output

  • Prism validates both request and response data
  • If your specification contains an invalid example or your request isn't compliant with your API description, Prism can flag it for you!
  • Validation Proxy Mode:
    • Identify discrepancies between the OpenAPI document and target API to help frontend developers integrating with your API
    • Ideal for pre-prod environments to ensure that OpenAPI documents and code stay in sync


API Mocking Tools: Prism Frank Kilcommins: API Management in Practice: Introduction to API Mocking

(10) API Mocking: (Advanced) Mocking Callbacks

  • Go beyond standard API interactions
  • OpenAPI 3.0+ allows API designers to define callbacks and construct URLs for payload delivery
  • Prism supports callback mocking, enabling you to interact/integrate callbacks before the realAPI is built

(12) Exercise: Mock an API

  • Using the OpenAPI Description you created in exercise 2 to create a mock API using Prism
  • Guide steps:
    • Install Prism
    • Run Prism with your OpenAPI description (via Node or Docker)
    • Interact with the mock API
